@description.body:
*****************************************************************

qooxdoo - the new era of web development http://qooxdoo.org Copyright: 2004-2008 1&1 Internet AG, Germany, http://www.1und1.de License: MIT: https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT See the LICENSE file in the project's top-level directory for details. @description.name: @description
@description.body: A popup which contains palettes of colors and the possibility to open the Colorselector to choose a color.

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: selector-button {qx.ui.form.Button} button to open the color selector
@childControl.description: button to open the color selector

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: preview-pane {qx.ui.groupbox.GroupBox} group box to show the old and the new color
@childControl.description: group box to show the old and the new color

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The hex value of the selected color.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The numeric red value of the selected color.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The numeric green value of the selected color.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The numeric blue value of the selected color.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
id {String} ID of the child control. If a # is used, the id is
   the part in front of the #.
@param.description:
ID of the child control. If a # is used, the id is
   the part in front of the #.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
hash {String?undefined} If a child control name contains a #,
   all text following the # will be the hash argument.
@param.description:
If a child control name contains a #,
   all text following the # will be the hash argument.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates the GroupBoxes containing the colored fields.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates the ColorSelector and adds buttons.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Property apply

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds the most recent selected color to the "Recent colors" list. If this list is full, the first color will be removed before inserting the new one.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Listener of pointerdown event on a color field. Sets the ColorPoup's value to field's color value and paint the preview pane.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Listener of pointermove event on a color field. Sets preview pane's background color to the field's color value.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Listener of pointerout event on a color field. Reset the preview pane's background color to the old color value.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Listener of execute event on the "cancel" button. Hides the ColorPopup and resets it's color value.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Listener of execute event on the "Open ColorSelector" button. Opens a ColorSelector widget and hides the ColorPopup.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Listener of execute event on the "OK" button. Hides the ColorPopup and sets it's color value to the selected color.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Listener of execute event on the "Cancel" button. Hides the ColorPopup.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Listener for visibility changes. Sets preview pane's background color to the current color, when the popup is visible.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property value. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #value}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property value. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #value}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property value. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #value}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the location data like {qx.bom.element.Location#get} does, but does not rely on DOM elements coordinates to be rendered. Instead, this method works with the available layout data available in the moment when it is executed. This works best when called in some type of resize or move event which are supported by all widgets out of the box.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map|null} Returns a map with left, top, right and bottom which contains the distance of the widget relative coords the document.
@return.description: Returns a map with left, top, right and bottom which contains the distance of the widget relative coords the document.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the position. Uses low-level, high-performance DOM methods when the property {@link #domMove} is enabled. Checks if an always visible element is set and moves the widget to not overlay the always visible widget if possible. The algorithm tries to move the widget as far left as necessary but not of the screen. ({@link #setVisibleElement})

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Places the widget to another (at least laid out) widget. The DOM element is not needed, but the bounds are needed to compute the location of the widget to align to.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
liveupdate {Boolean} Flag indicating if the position of the
 widget should be checked and corrected automatically.
@param.description:
Flag indicating if the position of the
 widget should be checked and corrected automatically.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the widget was successfully placed
@return.description: true if the widget was successfully placed

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Places the widget to the pointer position.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: event {qx.event.type.Pointer} Pointer event to align to

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Places the widget to any (rendered) DOM element.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: elem {Element} DOM element to align to

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
liveupdate {Boolean} Flag indicating if the position of the
 widget should be checked and corrected automatically.
@param.description:
Flag indicating if the position of the
 widget should be checked and corrected automatically.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Places the widget in relation to the given point

@param.name: @param
@param.body: point {Map} Coordinate of any point with the keys left and top.
@param.description: Coordinate of any point with the keys left and top.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the placement offsets as a map

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the size of the object to place. The callback will be called with the size as first argument. This methods works asynchronously. The size of the object to place is the size of the widget. If a widget including this mixin needs a different size it can implement the method _computePlacementSize, which returns the size.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
callback {Function} This function will be called with the size as
    first argument
@param.description:
This function will be called with the size as
    first argument

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Internal method to read specific this properties and apply the results to the this afterwards.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: coords {Map} Location of the object to align the this to. This map should have the keys left, top, right and bottom.
@param.description: Location of the object to align the this to. This map should have the keys left, top, right and bottom.
